content.raw:
To be honest, I feel like we're building functionality here on top of something that should be considered a bug (probably introduced in the Qt port of runmanager). runmanager was never meant to be able to compile multiple sequences simulatenously. I'm all for supporting adding support for this as a new feature, but I'm concerned that building it on top of a shaky foundation will lead to bigger problems down the road. So I think the best approach is to fix the original bug (the compile and abort buttons should never both be clickable; it should be one or the other) and then consider how to best approach the implementation of multiple sequence compilations (including how best to display this in the UI).

So I'm inclined to decline this pull request until we have a better plan for how to integrate #45 and #47 in with the other "just-in-time" compilation features that are being worked on at NIST.
